description.narrative:
ACUDES' main intervention areas are governance, extractive industry, environment, employability, development and vocational training. Acudes is based in Inhambane province. Acudes presides over the provincial forum of the Inhambane civil society organizations. This organization works in the districts of Jangamo, Homoíne, Murrumbene and in the city of Inhambane. Your donors are MASC and PEPFAR. The organization has HIV and gender as areas of intervention. The organization has history in relation to the extractive industry especially Sasol (located in Pande and Temane) which was the first company to work in the area of extractive industry. The province of Inhambane is one of the provinces that is least supported by donors or civil society financing mechanisms. However, Acudes shows a tendency to reverse this scenario, especially the way how the forum of civil society organizations is leaded. The organization has managed to mobilize funds in a regular way, to the provincial forum, as well as to its benefit. Mission: To develop in local communities, capacities and skills that promote critical reflection in order to eradicate poverty, promoting participatory and sustainable development. Vision: Promote a sustainable and participatory development of local communities and raise levels of consciousness about rights, cultural and moral values.
Values: Social justice, respect and solidarity for the human person, honesty, work and multiform socio-economic and cultural initiatives.

description.narrative: Increased political will: # of cases of influentials endorsing gender sensitive policy asks of Oxfam/partners towards quality and quantity of aid, as well as on civil society space..
alternative policies/approaches presented by Oxfam Novib and partners to duty bearers in and influencers of governments, global governmental actors and the private sector
campaigns in which Oxfam Novib and partners participated
